properties.address: Bristol Central Library, Bristol, Bristol BS1 5TL
properties.description: Bristol Libraries are open to everyone, you donâ€™t have to be a library member to make use of the spaces and services in the library but it is free to become a member and access the full range of services and borrowing. Bristol Libraries provide free access to books, online resources, online newspapers, computers, Wi-Fi, laptop and phone charging, study-spaces, business information, council information, family and local history, seating areas. All libraries have a range of free events and activities available; these will vary from library to library but include: Baby Bounce and Rhyme, story times, volunteer led digital support, crafts, talks, exhibitions, board games, jigsaws, reading groups, volunteering opportunities and more. Chargeable services include: photocopying and printing from our computers or Wi-Fi printing from your own device. More information on www.bristol.gov.uk/libraries

properties.description: A space where people who identify as living with disability in the BS13 and surrounding area drop-in for a friendly social and cuppa. A place where you can get peer support and share interests. It is also a space where a shared voice can take social action to affect positive change in the neighbourhood for people living with disability. The group meet fortnightly on a Friday afternoon between 1pm - 3pm in the Community Room, its level access from the street and has accessible toilet adjacent to the room. For more information contact Claire McNeil by email: claire.mcneil@bristol.gov.uk or tel. 07876814604

properties.address: Hanham Methodist Church, South Gloucestershire BS15 8SD
properties.description: Our pay-as-you-can cafe in Hanham is open to everyone. We serve breakfast, lunch, snacks and homemade cakes alongside great coffee, hot chocolate, chai latte, teas, milkshakes and soft drinks. We have a separate children's area with a selection of toys and plenty of space to run around. We regularly have supermarket surplus and fresh fruit, veg and salad from our Community Allotment available to take home. We run regular events including a monthly Eat & Meet, Knit & Craft and a weekly Bumps, Babies & Tots Meetup. Everything is pay-as-you-can and all contributions are anonymous.
properties.title: The Beacon Cafe Welcome Space

properties.address: Little Stoke Baptist Church, Bristol, Avon BS34 6JW
properties.description: A welcoming space offering hot and cold drinks, biscuits, cake and a light lunch on Thursdays. We also offer second hand clothes and table top items. It is the place for community, a place to be, a place for you.
properties.title: The Place

properties.address: Avonmouth Community Centre, Bristol, Avon BS11 9EN
properties.description: A drop in space open every weekday with sofas and cafÃ© style tables and chairs. Meet friends, play games and join in with the community jigsaw, or simply sit and read. We have groups and activities for all ages during the week as well as a range of lunchtime food opportunities at low cost.
properties.title: The Warm Welcome Community Centre

properties.address: St Andrews Church, Bristol, Avon BS11 9EN
properties.description: The Well cafe offers a warm space for a cup of tea and a chat! All refreshments are free including a light lunch of homemade soup and cake. Open every Tuesday 10-2pm. For over 18's only.
properties.title: The Well Listening Cafe

properties.address: Thornbury Library, Thornbury, South Gloucestershire BS35 2AA

properties.address: Trinity Cafe, Nailsea, North Somerset BS48 4NG
properties.description: A delightful warm space, adjoining Holy Trinity Church Nailsea, able to provide hot beverage, homemade cakes and other refreshments at significantly lower prices than commercial coffee shops. Come and try us on Monday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday between 9.00am and 1.00pm
properties.title: Trinity Cafe

properties.address: Holy Trinity Church Hall, South Gloucestershire BS15 4AB
properties.description: Trinity Welcome Space is open every Thursday 12pm - 5pm. Refreshments available (tea, coffee, squash, pastries plus soup when available). Surplus bread and pastries available to take home. Regular support and advice events including visits from other organisations. Wellbeing sessions available. Free charging points, always a friendly face.
properties.title: Trinity Welcome Space Kingswood

properties.address: Waterford Road, Bristol, Bristol BS9 4BT
properties.description: Drop in for warm drinks and snacks. Enjoy a chat. Recharge a mobile. Play some board games. Have some safe and welcoming space.
properties.title: Trinity-Henleaze United Reformed Church

properties.address: Turnaround Bristol, Lawrence Hill, Bristol BS5 0BJ
properties.description: Turnaround Bristol is a homelessness and vulnerable day centre for those living in and around Bristol. We are open Monday - Thursday (10am - 3pm) serving breakfast (10am-11am) and lunch (12:30pm - 1:30pm) whilst also providing a whole host of other interventions: access to computers and IT, Clothing Store, Showers, Laundry Facilities, 1:1 support, Tuesday support drop in with various agencies and more.
properties.title: Turnaround Bristol

properties.description: The Community Hub space is open to all as a warm welcoming centre of the community in Oldbury Court, Fishponds. We are offering a warm space, soup, coffee/tea and friendly chat. We also have information on damp, mould and ways to keep warm this winter.

properties.address: St. Marys Church, Bristol BS11 ODW
properties.description: We are a church in the heart of the community with a heart for the community. On Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Saturdays we offer relaxed and welcoming coffee mornings from 10:00 - 12:00. On Fridays, we extend our offer to bacon butties for breakfast and cooked lunch, including vegan and gluten free options all of which are free of charge. During our opening times we also provide a play area suitable for toddlers and live piano music on Fridays. All are welcome.

properties.address: Faithspace, Prewett Street, BS1 6PB
properties.description: Creative Space was created with and for local people; not just a class for people to learn to paint or draw, but more of a creative collaboration, to spark off each other and to support local people on a creative journey. The group provides a social opportunity where people can get to know others in the area whilst engaging in positive creative activities, learn new skills and reduce isolation. The group is accessible to people of all levels whether beginners or more advanced - it is a space where skills can be developed with and from others so everyone can learn together. Creative Space is a welcoming space where local people are supported to grow and develop in making art, to engage in developing joint projects and to share and develop creative skills and to showcase their work through local community events and activities. Free hot drinks & crafts - all abilities welcome!
properties.title: Creative Space Redcliffe - Bristol
